title: STEM Exploration Through Meteorological Phenomena and Data Analysis: Short-Term Project-Based Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Atmospheric Science Knowledge and Foundations of Data Analysis
context.additional_context: Real-time weather data analysis and region-specific problem-solving projects using digital devices.

learning_goals: Mesonet data can be utilized to analyze regional weather patterns and build predictive models.

In a PBL project based on an actual weather issue (e.g., heavy rainfall case), learners can collaborate with three team members (role division and two weekly meetings) to analyze weather data (five variables: temperature, precipitation, humidity, etc.) and write a 3-page decision-making report based on the analysis.
By applying the scientific principles of meteorological phenomena, solutions can be proposed for community issues (e.g., improving flood warning systems).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
